sectionConfigJson.title: Mission
sectionConfigJson.blurb: The OurHealth team is deeply committed to improving our understanding of the underlying genetic factors or cardiovascular risk in South Asian populations. Participants drive forward research by providing information about their lifestyle habits and medical history in the form of survey responses, as well as by donating biological samples for study and analysis. From these data. the OurHealth study team sequences and analyzes the data to uncover genomic trends, potentially revealing patterns in the causality of high cardiovascular disease in South Asian populations. South Asians have historically been underrepresented in genetic studies, a disparity the OurHeath team hones to address with your help.

sectionConfigJson.title: Background
sectionConfigJson.blurb:
Drs. Pradeep Natarajan and Amit Khera have years of experience in looking at genetic effects of disease overall. Recently, the have focused on genetics within South Asian populations.

By closely studying the contribution of genetics towards heart and metabolic disease in individuals of Sputh Asian ancestry living outside the United States, Drs Natarajan and Khera have helped develop a new genotyping array optimized for South Asians. Unfortunately, South Asian datasets remain limited in size, cultural diversity, and diaspora representation.

Help us close this gap! Join the OurHealth study and contribute to improving South Asian heart health.
